reviews.review: really good movie. I enjoyed it it was really funny

The best thing about Toy Story 4 is the animation. Compare it to the original and it's like night and day! 

Unfortunately, the rest of the movie was... fine. Woody spends the movie learning that he's completely unnecessary to Bonnie's life, which feels like a direct nod to this movies position in the series. Unnecessary. It had a few good laughs, but it's mostly just sad (without the heart of TS3). The kids at the theatre seemed bored, frankly. 

I will say, Forky made me laugh a lot, and ventriloquist dummies will never not be scary!

Also, was there supposed to be a short before the film? If so, my theatre didn't show it...

This movie is a solid addition to the franchise. Pixar is back in true form to deliver a fun, meaningful film to warm audience hearts around the world. It's less tear-jerking than previous entries, but it still weaves the Pixar signature great, meaningful narrative that bucks storytelling standard. There are some small but significant character deviations for Buzz and Bo Peep, and not always in a good way. But apart from some mostly harmless missteps it is the sequel fans hoped they could make and feared they wouldn't be able to pull off. Most people probably knew they were going to watch it before reading this, but if you were on the fence, definitely go see it.

Closest comparison: It's like a fresh Toy Story 3 with some of the logistical problems of Finding Dory and a touch of sequelitis.

Setting: Family Fantasy
Plot: Adventure
Tone: Family Adventure

Extremely overrated in my opinion. The worst of the 4. Not the Woody that we grew to love and no need to make Bo the independent feminist who doesn't need kids because she's better on her own conquering the world.
Great family movie.  No politics or anti Christian message like most movies nowadays.
So funny and enjoyable for the entire family!
While I would say that this movie didn't technically need to be made since I thought the third movie ended on a perfect note, I still thought this was a great movie that tugs on your heartstrings.
Toy Story 4 was lot of fun and a great way to finish up the series.  Not quite the emotional gut-punch of Toy Story 3, but that almost makes it more watchable.  The whole family loved it.
Absolutely fabulous for both young and old.  The adult humor built in makes this a great movie for the entire family.
Bro this movie was soooo freaking funny. I’m not the type to laugh at movies, but I was crying laughing at this one. I’m sure my happy plants played a part in that.  (:
